lexUnit.name: purge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to free from impurities, cleanse, rid of unwanted things

sentence.text: If the VAX/VMS disk quota has been exceeded ( check by using VMS command SHOW QUOTA ) , you should inform the System Manager or purge the account of all unnecessary files .
They even expressed affection obscenely , as if to purge their relationships of any possible betraying taint .
To purge themselves of earthly desires -- that was all they were worried about .
Its senior partner , the Communist Party , has not carried all its followers with it this summer , and last month had to purge the entire leadership of its youth movement ( KNE ) .
He 'd done something like it before , he 'd tried to purge himself of privilege by becoming a tramp , descending among the down-and-outs of London and Paris .
Seb realised immediately that Boz was seeking trouble as a means of purging himself of the anger and frustration that was bubbling inside him .
Because I need to purge myself of the past more than anything .
Bob had helped purge Martha of the terrible guilt that had haunted her since her sister Maria 's death .
At both extremes of anorexia or bulimia the sufferers may use medications to induce vomiting or to reduce body fluid or to purge themselves either with laxatives or enemas or both .
But another work by Lysippus , showing the hero Hercules purging the Augean Stables , was exhibited in Rome next to a statue of the triumphant Fabius Maximus on horseback .
The army has been purged half-heartedly .
If we believe that Ireland can be purged of the Dark Lords and the Wolfline reinstated , then we will join with you . "
The secret police was finally purged , with its chief , Yagoda , perishing along with other senior personnel .
It failed , and the general purged the armed forces and created a power structure that strengthened his supporters ' hold on the military .
Neither the campaign nor the result purged him or his family of a settled if unenthusiastic feeling that he ought to go into the House of Commons .
It is not necessary to purge the political and academic language which we use to think about the inner city , only to be aware of its contingent value .
They were also seeking to purge their religion of recently acquired alien elements and to restore it to what they deemed its original purity .
But then he has it , he 's off and running , he 's merging and purging that database with frantic abandon .
